title: `diffwrapper`'s tabs doesn't work for previews
body:
It isn't possible to switch from Simple diff to Compact or side-by-side diff when previewing a comment. Switching works for the published comment.

![Screenshot from 2022-08-12 12-58-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/184340967-3be826e4-e36b-413e-a187-42e4e24226b6.png)

title: Latex math conflicts with angular variable expansion
body:
When we have latex math with ``{{SOMETHING}}``, angular tries to parse it as a variable, and fails.

Suggested solution - escape this somehow.

title: File selector issue
body: I have a few reports on issues with the file selector. Have so far been unable to reproduce the issue, and the only commonality seems to be that they are using WebKit-based browsers. If so, this could be related with #1123. **Rendering example (placement of links is incorrect; links don't open the file selector)**

title: File upload progression glitch for Safari
body:
When uploading multiple files using Safari the progression graphic glitch for some of the files.

Reported for Safari 11 (outdated?), but was able to reproduce using Safari 13 (stable).

title: devilry_useradd str decoding error
body:
It seems the update to Python 3 (issue #1103) broke the `devilry_useradd` management command.

We get the following error from [line 53](https://github.com/devilry/devilry-django/blob/master/devilry/devilry_superadmin/management/commands/devilry_useradd.py#L53): `TypeError: decoding str is not supported`. It [got slightly modified](https://github.com/devilry/devilry-django/commit/128c009f25ddbda16329511b05a03594ef6f5b34#diff-355904e8980b2035fda9d9e6ccc638ba) in 128c009f25ddbda16329511b05a03594ef6f5b34.

title: Compressed archives aren't dicarded when candidate numbers are changed
body:
Compressed archive files are automatically discarded (not re-used) if their content changes (a student upload another file), the requestee's permissions to the student changes (issue #982), and a whole other range of reasons.

For semi anonymous assignments, the directories in the compressed files for admin and examiners are set to the candidate number(s) of the student(s) instead of their user names. It seems we forgot to add candidate numbers changing as a scenario for when to renew the compressed archive files.

**Workarounds**
After overwriting existing candidate numbers with the [`periodsetrelatedstudents` command](https://devilry.readthedocs.io/en/latest/sysadmin/managementcommands.html#devilry-periodsetrelatedstudents) you'll need to delete existing compressed archive files for the admins and each examiners as a superuser.

If you can't be sure the relevant compressed archive files gets deleted, you probably want to go for the nuclear option:

- `venv/bin/python manage.py devilry_delete_compressed_archives --all`

title: Qualifed for exam doesn't reflect group fixes
body:
During the last semester, we addressed a few issues with how multiple deadlines on group assignments could lead to problems with how the final result was displayed in certain views (issue #1084 among others).

We just had an issue with a student that got all assignments approved, but the qualified for exam results is different than the semester overview result. The qualified for exam was produced long after the student's last feedback. Even more strange - the student had collaborated with the same partner for all assignments throughout the semester, but they had different results in the qualified for exam.

I suspect qualified for exam is missing some of the fixes for multiple deadlines.

title: Internal notes on group deliveries does not show in delivery history
body:
When adding an internal note on a delivery this usually shows in blue as part of the history on a delivery. A note saying "Comment added" shows in green at the top of the delivery and mail is also sent to the other examiners assigned to this delivery. This is apparently not the case when the delivery is done by a group. That is, the "Comment added" note is shown and the mail to the other listeners is sent, but the note does not show in the delivery history.

This has been tested for two different users on three different group deliveries consisting of groups with 2 and 3 collaborators.

Note that this is for Devilry v3.4.6.

title: Wrong result value in assignment feedback notifications
body:
When reproducing #1079, I realized the info in the email notifications was misleading.

The assignment had a threshold of 15 points, and the grades were 8, 12 and 16 so only the last email notification should had said `Result: passed`. All three notifications did however say `Result: passed`.

title: Moving deadline for failed student masks current status as failed
body:
If an administrator moves an individual deadline for an assignment with hard deadlines, after an examiner has fails the assignment due to no delivery, the assignment will remain `Failed` in multiple views while it for the student behaves as its status is `Waiting for deliveries`.

**Feedback feed**
![screenshot from 2018-10-23 15-42-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/47364910-b7394b00-d6da-11e8-9aac-e7473234ac6c.png)

**Student dashboard**
![screenshot from 2018-10-23 15-46-52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/47365067-0aab9900-d6db-11e8-9826-d5385d8f126d.png)

**Examiner's assignment overview**
![screenshot from 2018-10-23 15-48-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/47365178-4cd4da80-d6db-11e8-8796-483aea951312.png)

Most critical, in the admin's student overview for the assignment, the assignment doesn't sort as `Waiting for deliveries`.

title: Filter for deleting students based on other assignments' results is incomplete
body:
Selecting students to delete from an assignment if they fail another assignment should contain all students that failed the selected assignment, with the following exceptions:

> **Last attempt not graded**
> Simply means that whether or not they have multiple attempts, the last attempt is not corrected and therefore not counted as failed.
> 
> **More than one student**
> If a project group on the current assignment has more than one student (a collaborative group). You can still delete this project group manually, or split and then delete if you only want to delete one of the students in the project group.

The list of students presented by the tool is incomplete if that's all the exceptions it makes. For one concrete example it's missing about half the students that should have been suggested for deletion.

title: 'periodsetrelatedstudents' overwrites deactivations
body:
The `devilry_periodsetrelatedstudents` management command can be used to synchronize data from other sources into Devilry. Unfortunately, the command doesn't respect the deactivate status so synchronization currently overwrites any deactivation.

**Suggested solution**
- Make the command respect deactivations

You could add a `--reactivate` option for when the current behavior is needed, but I don't think that's needed.

title: Batch operation for admin zip file fails
body:
`batchframework_admin_compress_assignment` fails due to `DataError: integer out of range` for one of our assignments. It prepares for six-seven minutes before it fails. The assignment has about 150 students with deliveries that includes audio files.

Admin zip files work well for other assignments.

title: Grades without feedback don't display examiner
body:
**Issue**
If an examiner grades a delivery without also adding a comment, the grading action is displayed without any information of who did the grading:

![screenshot from 2018-09-27 13-17-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/46142700-14ff8200-c258-11e8-9548-09ecc6533995.png)

**Solution**
Include the name and username similar to deadline moves:

![screenshot from 2018-09-27 13-23-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/796053/46142876-a3740380-c258-11e8-83e9-0b8222c4576a.png)

title: Error with filters for passed previous semester
body:
Students listed by `Automatically pass students from an earlier semester` seems to not be filtered correctly. The tool lets an admin select an assignment from the previous fall, but the list of students presented contains something completely different.

The content is on the following form:
```
Full Name (username)
Assignment name - Semester Year

passed (1/1) -> passed (1/1)
```

The listed contained suggestions to import failed results as passed, and the assignment names and semesters are different, and does not match what you selected in the tool dialog.

I have yet to find a pattern for where the information comes from. I have also documented that the suggestions are available to all admins for the period, even admins without access to the previous semester the results should have been gathered from.

title: Results overview lack point prefetch function
body:
**Note:** this works in `3.2.0` and crashes in `3.3.0b5`.

Overview of all results (under 'Utilities' on the semester overview) gives a server error. It seems to lack a function or the data that function should get.

```
AttributeError at /devilry_admin/period/1454/overview_all_results/all-results-overview

get_point_to_grade_map() requires AssignmentQuerySet.prefetch_point_to_grade_map().
```

The same AttributeError has also been logged for `/devilry_admin/studentfeedbackfeedwizard/groups/123456789`

title: Minor nav fixes
body:
# Navigation in Edit passed previous semester
- In the view for `Edit passed previous assignment` for an assignment, the back button is missing in the heading.

- In the view for `Automatically pass students from an earlier semester`, the back button takes you to the dashboard instead of the passed pervious semester

title: Group split could lead to attributeError
body:
Splitting out one student from a project group can result in a 500 server error due to `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_anonymous_name'` when trying to view the feedback dialog for the lone student.

I suspect it is due to an error with displaying the actions of the other students (uploads, comments, etc) that no longer is part of the lone delivery. Similar to the non-critical error that causes participants' name to be missing from feedback dialog (issue #961).

title: Statistics from Assignment overview is wrong
body:
In this case it says `6 students organized in 7 project groups 2 examiners configured.` when there is in fact 7 students organized in 6 project groups.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93136/38498947-62ec55ac-3c06-11e8-9612-24cbf57eecfe.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93136/38498992-83afd354-3c06-11e8-99ed-eee41732898f.png)

title: Zip files for examiners aren't unique
body:
The deliveries for an assignment are usually divided between multiple examiners. It looks like there's an issue with the uniqueness of Zip files for examiners within the same assignment.

If there isn't any Zip files for the assignment, a new Zip file for that examiner is generated. If there is a Zip file for the assignment, no new Zip file is generated. Instead the examiner is served the existing Zip file, even if it contains the assignment another examiner is assigned.

No new batch operations is logged for the second download.

body:
Alt fungerer logisk, men meldingen viser anonymous id

title: Bug when updating examiners through REST
body:
*This affects the version of Devilry currently deployed at IFI.*
I'm trying to send a PUT request on an assignment group to change the examiners of a group.

If the group initially has one examiner, Alpha, and one tries to set the new examiners to Alpha and Beta, Devilry responds with a 400 with the error message "The same user can not be examiner multiple times on the same group."

The json sent looks like this (with identifying data replaced with variables)
```
{'id': id1, 'candidates': [{'user': {'username': uname, 'displayname': X, 'id': id2, 'full_name': X, 'email': X}, 'id': id3, 'candidate_id': None}], 'examiners': [{'user': {'id': ex_uid_alpha}}, {'user': {'id': ex_uid_beta}}], 'is_open': True, 'tags': [{'tag': 'rettegruppeX', 'id': id4}]}
```

If I first remove all examiners, and then add Alpha and Beta, then everything works fine.

title: The waiting for feedback count query on the examiner dashboard does not count for only the requesting examiner

milestone.description: Primary focus: Make user management far more powerful and streamlined without the need of an external user/role system.

body: This means that the status shown is for all students within the assignment, not just the students the examiner is correcting.

title: oblig ``bulk download'' not complete
body:
Hi, I stumbled upon the following bug. In a role as "course examiner" I am supposed to correct a bunch of hand-ins. A very welcome feature of devilry is the "bulk-downlod" where I can get a zipped/archived bundle of all the solutions I need to correct.

Now: I just observed, that the "archived download" does /not/ contain all the solutions, i.e., those I can see (and click/download) when surfing the students entry in the given assignment individually. At least one was missing (I have not checked all).  That's disturbing, because this way, the off-line bulk-download is unreliable and needs to be cross-checked with the online-version not to miss out solutions. For large courses, that's quite some overhead, to check consistency.

Martin

title: The bulkimport users view uses querystring to transport users

milestone.description: Primary focus: Make user management far more powerful and streamlined without the need of an external user/role system.

body: This will easily reach the maximum size of the URL in many browsers (especially IE). Must be transported via POST. Should probably be fixed as part of #760.

title: Projectgroup page is not visible unless admins have enabled "Students can form project groups"
body: This view must be available if there are more than one student in a group. We should simply disable all invite features unless admins has enabled that.

title: Update (old and inconsistent) management-commands
body:
These docs: https://devilry.readthedocs.org/en/latest/sysadmin/managementcommands.html
need to be updated. Managements commands should be updated to reflect how they work today, example here:
https://devilry.readthedocs.org/en/latest/sysadmin/gettingstarted.html#if-you-do-not-have-an-existing-database-add-some-data

title: Missing feedback
body:
In the new user-interface for students, all feedback from 2013 and older appear to be missing?

This applies to both the "recent feedbacks", and "recent deliveries" lists.

All the data is still in the database, but could be an error with the cached status-field.

title: It is possible to set deadline handling for non-electronic assignments

milestone.description: Primary focus: Make user management far more powerful and streamlined without the need of an external user/role system.

body: Non-electronic assignments should have deadline handling set to SOFT, and the deadline-handling editing widget should be removed from the sidebar.

title: Examiners on non-electronic deliveries have a button to create a new deadline

milestone.description: Primary focus: Make user management far more powerful and streamlined without the need of an external user/role system.

body:
It seems like the new chance/new try workflow is the same for non-electronic and electronic deliveries. For non-electronic deliveries, we should have the same workflow, but we should:
- Re-open the group
- Add another fake delivery

But NOT add another deadline.

title: The delete button for Period is never shown
The user import script resets tags and possibly examiners

milestone.description: Primary focus: Make user management far more powerful and streamlined without the need of an external user/role system.

body: The user import scripts resets tags for all users. This makes period-level tagging unusable.

title: Javascript is not loading in the examiner UI
body: Not sure why, but it may have to do with the refactoring. Should be fixed after #631 since that will most likely just re-copy the entire examiner UI from v1.

title: Sorting does not work as intended for group deliveries
body: For now I guess we should just create a quickfix that sorts by ID for group deliveries, and fix this with a database specific query for the next major release.

title: The devilry_detektor app stops processing halfway through parsing the code
body: No idea why, but if it crashes with an exception, there may be something wrong with the Celery exception logging setup since the task seems to be completed successfully, and no errors are in the logs.

title: Groups with no deadlines are shown in all deadlines in the deadlines overview for subject admins
body: This error was discovered when we fixed #604. It does not cause any problems, but it looks strange in the UI.

title: 500 error when loading the deadline or group views after deleting a deadline
body: I think this error is bacause groups are left with no deadline.

title: Text cursor out of sync in markdow editor
body:
Text cursor out of sync in markdow editor when using latest Chrome.

This is most likely an [ACE editor](http://ace.c9.io/) bug. I guess it is this bug: https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace/issues/2151, or perhaps https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace/issues/2130. In any case, updating ACE will most likely fix the problem.
## Workaround

Use something other than Chrome. Latest Firefox is reported to work.

title: Qualified for final exams not working
body: Uncaught Error: Ext.Loader is not enabled, so dependencies cannot be resolved dynamically. Missing required class: Ext.layout.container.Anchor

title: Examiner stats does not show on courses with one examiner
body: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'user' of undefined

title: PointToGradeMap.points_to_grade matches outside the current assignment
body: This seems to be caused by us using managers wrong for Django 1.4. The current method should work in Django 1.5, but we need a workaround for Django 1.4.

title: The Next-button is disabled in "create new non-electronic assignment"
body:
To reproduce this:
1. Click "Create new assignment"
2. Fill in the fields in order (name, short name, and select "Not using Devilry").
3. The Next button should still be disabled.

This seems to be because the "Submission date" field does not validate.
## Workaround

You just need to fill in a valid "Submission date" before the field is hidden. I.E.:
1. Click "Create new assignment"
2. Leave _Using devilry_ selected in _How do students add deliveries_, and fill in all the other fields, including a valid "Submission date".
3. Select _Not using devilry_.
4. The Next button should now be enabled.

title: The custom-table points_to_grade_mapper wizard does not re-validate and leads to invalid grading system setup
body:
This issue happens when a course admin uses the _custom table_ method for mapping points to grade. The problem is that we are missing a save, so the point to grade mapping table is left with `invalid=True` no matter what the user does.
## Workaround (for system administrators)

NOTE: This fix is a fairly manual update of the database. It is fairly safe since it uses the same API as our webinterface, but you may want to backup the database before proceeding.
### 1. Find the ID of the assignment

> Navigate to the assignment as course admin or node admin. The ID is the number at the end of the URL. 
### 2. Open the Django shell (on the server where you run updates)

```
$ bin/django.py shell
```
### 3. Find the assignment using the API

Do not type `>>>`, it is just an indicator for the Django/python shell.

First, we need to import the Assignment API and get the assignment by ID:

``` python
>>> from devilry.apps.core.models import Assignment
>>> assignment = Assignment.objects.get(id=<the id you found in step 1>)
>>> assignment.get_path()
... make sure it is the correct assignment
```

Next, we need to make sure we are actually experiencing _this_ issue:

``` python
>>> assignment.points_to_grade_mapper
... make sure it is u'custom-table'
>>> assignment.pointtogrademap.invalid
... make sure it is True
```

If everything looks OK, the two commands below will fix this issue:

``` python
>>> assignment.pointtogrademap.clean()
>>> assignment.pointtogrademap.invalid
... make sure it is False
>>> assignment.pointtogrademap.save()
```

Hit `CTRL-D` to quit the Django shell.

title: Passed previous period does not work with the new gradingsystem
body: Needs at least a patch, but we could also rewrite it with support for more than just passed/failed assignments.

title: The is_last_delivery check is wrong - causes all last/not last delivery messages to be inverted
body: Should be a simple fix.

title: Changing any of the editable properties on an assignment resets the grading system settings
body:
This seems to be a bug in djangorestframework. Even if I override the PUT method and sets the field manually, the framework still ends up creating an SQL update that is wrong.
## Solution

Create a separate edit page for assignment, and make the 3 edit links go there.

title: The delivery_status of AssigmentGroup is not saved or updated
body:
The order is wrong in AssignmentGroup.save(). We have to set the delivery_status _before_ we call super (super saves). I know that we have not implemented update yet, so not updating is not really a bug, but I plan to write the tests in one go, so might as well fix updates at the same time.
## How do we update delivery_status?
- When creating the group (set to `no-deadlines`). Already works.
- When creating a deadline (change from `no-deadlines` to `waiting-for-something`). Implemented in #501.
- When adding a StaticFeedback (change to `corrected`). This is already handled in `StaticFeedback.save()` because we set `active_feedback` and save the group.

title: Garbled text when printing the qualified for exams list to PDF
body:
@arnem reported an issue with print to PDF in IE10. We do not know what print driver the report is for. May be this issue if it is the Adobe printer driver:
http://helpx.adobe.com/acrobat/kb/missing-or-garbled-text-printing.html
## Workaround

Use one of the following alternative solutions:
- Print to XPS and convert the XPS-file to PDF.
- Use Chrome and its built-in PDF-printer.
- Use http://www.pdfforge.org/pdfcreator (opensource PDF printer for windows)

title: Sort groups/students on an assignment by fullname throws TypeError
body:
When sorting students/groups on an assignment by fullname, we get the following exception:

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'split' of null 
```

I think this is caused by users with missing full name.

title: django-celery-email error "Received unregistered task of type 'djcelery_email_send'."
body:
## Traceback

```
[2013-11-12 09:53:14,495: INFO/MainProcess] consumer: Connected to amqp://devilry@127.0.0.1:5672/devilryhost.
[2013-11-12 09:55:09,065: ERROR/MainProcess] Received unregistered task of type 'djcelery_email_send'.
The message has been ignored and discarded.

Did you remember to import the module containing this task?
Or maybe you are using relative imports?
More: http://docs.celeryq.org/en/latest/userguide/tasks.html#names

The full contents of the message body was:
{'utc': True, 'chord': None, 'args': (<django.core.mail.message.EmailMessage object at 0x12d08450>,), 'retries': 0, 'expires': None, 'task': 'djcelery_email_send', 'callbacks': None, 'errbacks': None, 'taskset': None, 'kwargs': {'_backend_init_kwargs': {'username': None, 'password': None}}, 'eta': None, 'id': '96445c40-e97c-45b6-afba-cbf6dd8e79e6'} (1132b)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/ifi/asgard/p00/devilry/devilrybuild/buildoutcache/eggs/celery-3.0.13-py2.7.egg/celery/worker/consumer.py", line 435, in on_task_received
    strategies[name](message, body, message.ack_log_error)
KeyError: ‘djcelery_email_send'
```
## Workaround

Do not use `django-celery-email`.

title: Bug with multiple $math$ in single line

body:
The following sentence will not render properly in feedback:

La $math$s\in A^_$/math$. Følgende funksjon bytter om a-er og b-er i strenger i $math$A^_$/math$.

However, if I split the line, both halves render perfectly:

La $math$s\in A^*$/math$.

title: The page title in most views in the courseadmin UI is missing the name of the current object

title: Problem with search function for students in semester
body:
Through the following work flow as course administrator, a get a problem with the search function for students in a semester:

Going to a semester -> students on semester -> searching for 'something' -> going back to the semester -> opening an assignment -> opening students on the assignment -> going back to the semester -> showing students on semester

Now i get the matches for 'something' no matter what I type in the search field. I now have to go to the Devilry front page and back to make it work again.

title: Timeout when setting examiner on a huge amount of groups
IntegrityError in the "Approved previous semester" wizard
body:
The wizard fails when saving. The error message is:

```
duplicate key value violates unique constraint "core_delivery_alias_delivery_id_key"
```

We have the full traceback, but can not paste it in case it contains some private data.

title: Trouble adding examiners to groups using tags
body:
With tags like gruppe1, gruppe2, ... , gruppe11 I get a problem where every group gets the right examiner, but groups tagged gruppe1 also gets the examiners from gruppe10 and gruppe11. I.e. every group with the tag gruppe1 gets three examiners.

If this is by design, I will just make sure that no tags contain another tag.

title: You are not registered as student message missing coursename in student history view
body: ![screen shot 2013-08-13 at 13 49 30](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/84501/954189/951356b4-040e-11e3-9a40-3eef2c866bae.png)

title: Download all files (.zip) on a single delivery does not work.
body:
It seems the URL points to the wrong ID, which results in a permission denied error in the API. Superusers and node admins may get the wrong files as a result of this. We also have some reports of this button returning a regular file instead of a zip-file, which may mean that the URL is for the wrong API instead of the wrong ID.

In any case, this should not be a security issue, because all our APIs check for permissions.
## Workaround

Download files individually, or download all files on the assignment.

title: Parts of feedback not showing in feedback with LaTeX math

milestone.title: Fix minor issues with the new UIs from 1.2.1
milestone.description: We put all minor issues from 1.2.1 that we do not believe to be critical here. These issues will most likely be released as minor versions 1.2.1 (1.2.1.X), and then we will release 1.2.2 when all issues are closed.

body:
This seems to be a MathJAX + jQuery problem. The box containing the feedback is sized upon first rendering the text, then MathJAX converts LaTeX, which may increase the size of the feedback so it disappears behind the bottom edge.

Resizing the window (or making the window resized by opening the debugger) or switching tabs, will force it to render again, which will make the box get the appropriate size showing the rest of the content.

I suggest adding a callback to have jQuery re-render the box when MathJAX is done or wait until MathJAX is done before rendering.

title: Internet Explorer 10 - loading forever
body:
After logging in (as student) on Internet Explorer 10, and choosing an assignment, loading overlay never dissapears.
![devilry](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4330864/458754/32ca1608-b3e8-11e2-8f7b-f071e9b3b586.png)

title: Add new deadline on specific groups hangs on firefox
body: Seems to be some kind of double loading issue.

title: List of available examiners are highly unstable, bordering unusable
body: When assigning examiners you can choose from a list of examiners for the current semester. On INF2080, this list always contain Herman Ruge Jervell and Roger Antonsen when I log into devilry. Myself and the other examiner (peterbb), I have to add every time I want to make changes. Usually this will cause no examiners to show up in the interface for adding examiners (not even Herman or Roger). If I try to register new examiners, we are all there already. I try to refresh for a while, and sometimes it works, sometimes it just resets available examiners to Roger and Herman.

title: Removing students from groups does not work when HARD deadlines have expired
body:
This is basically the same issue as #407. When we split a group, we copy all deliveries made by  student into a new group. That means we have to create new deliveries, and the Delivery-model checks for expired HARD deadlines.

We can solve this in two ways:
1. Work around the issue for this case only.
2. Move hard-deadline checking to the add-delivery API.

I believe the second solution is best, because it allows us to let admins and examiner APIs ignore hard deadlines. Using the second solution also solves the examiner API issue in #407 that we had to postpone because the the UI uses old frozen APIs.

title: Filter students uses http instead of https
body: The search for groups in students overview on an assignment uses http instead of https for some reason. This causes some browsers to ignore the request (as they should). This is not as critical as it may sound - the API only responds with names and usernames, and secure browsers ignore it.

title: Not able to register a non-electronic deliveries after deadline with HARD deadlines
body:
I am not able to register a non-electronic delivery for students in my course. 

Creating a dummy delivery with the add non-electronic delivery button returns without any error message, but it seems that no delivery is registered. And when I attempt to add feedback to selected and set the status of the assignment to approved, I am not able to do this since devilry claims that the assignment is not registered.

The name of the course is mat-inf2360, and it is the first compulsory exercise in that course.

title: Får ikke endret feedback
body: Når jeg først har gitt en tilbakemelding, går det ikke an å endre tilbakemeldingen. Av og til er det en knapp der som gjør at jeg kan gå inn på det jeg har skrevet, men ofte er den ikke der.

title: Haystack causes ImportError: cannot import name Node with all management commands
body:
This is cause by the problem described here: http://django-haystack.readthedocs.org/en/v1.2.7/debugging.html#import-errors-on-start-up-mentioning-handle-registrations.

A fix is to load models inline (at runtime).

title: ValueError: No JSON object could be decoded when selecting Simple Schema grading system
body: This is caused by missing configuration, which occurs because we do not create a config automatically. A workaround is to go into the old admin interface (`http://devilry.example.com/administrator/`), and set a temporary config, and then return to the new UI to edit the config.

title: Fix, or ignore the test failures in student.simplified and examiner.simplified

milestone.title: Fix minor issues with the new UIs from 1.2.1
milestone.description: We put all minor issues from 1.2.1 that we do not believe to be critical here. These issues will most likely be released as minor versions 1.2.1 (1.2.1.X), and then we will release 1.2.2 when all issues are closed.

body: There are some test failures in the simplified APIs for student and examiner. I think we can simply ignore the errors in student because those APIs should not be used anymore (need to double check that). The errors in examiner needs to be fixed. I think they are caused by API changes in core, which probably means that the tests are outdated, not an actual error in the implementation.

title: Can not sort by label in period overview
Trouble with browse-function for students in certain courses

labels.name: closed-not-relevant
labels.description: Clean up of old issues due to inactivity or irrelevance

body:
For students in some courses, e.g. INF1100 and INF2100, it seems that just open assignments or assignments not yet passed deadline, can be shown by the "Browse" function. 

The only way to look up old assignments, say you want to look up your total score in a course, is to use the search tool on the dashboard. Then you need to write down each score and sum up manually. 

This is not the case for all courses. We know that INF3331 and INF3151 does not have the problem, and students who attended INF1100 last year can view their old assignments perfectly.

title: Examiners and admins can add feedback to unsuccessful deliveries

labels.name: closed-not-relevant
labels.description: Clean up of old issues due to inactivity or irrelevance

body:
Examiners and admins can use the detailed student overview to add feedback on students without any successful deliveries. This causes students to get feedback that they can not view because, from their perspective, the delivery does not exist.
## Why do admins and examiners see unsuccessful deliveries?

See #337
## How does it happen?

Deliveries are created when a student uploads a file. If they never click "Finish delivery", the delivery is never marked as successful.
## What to do with affected students?

We will create a management script that a system admin can use to manually set deliveries to successful.
## Suggested patch

Fix #337, and throw an exception if a feedback is added to an unsuccessful delivery.

title: Addings students changes the studentquery - makes the view display wrong values when giving feedback
body:
To reproduce, create a new assignment, add a student, and try to give feedback to that student.

Note that the data is stored in the database. You only have to refresh the page to see the correctly stored results.

title: Breadcrumb navigation back to assignment from the students view does not always work

milestone.title: 1.2 - New subjectadmin UI
milestone.description: The 1.2 version of Devilry will include a brand new administrator user interface for administrators.

body:
To reproduce the problem:
- Open an assignment
- Choose _deadlines_
- Expand a deadline and click a group to open it in the students manager.
- Try to navigate back to the assignment using breadcrumbs

title: The Simple schema grade editor sets the grade string to "pass"
body: Only on some browsers. Firefox 14 may be one of these browsers, however we have not been able to reproduce the error yet. IE and Chrome seems to work without this issue.

title: 404 upon successful login in Chrome on Android

milestone.title: 1.2.1 - Complete the updates of all the old admin UIs
milestone.description: In this milestone, we will add a few more utilities to the subject administrator UI from 1.2. We will also create a completely new but very simple UI for node (faculty, department) admins.

body:
When logging in from Chrome on my Android tablet (nexus 7 with CM10) I get redirected to https://devilry.ifi.uio.no/apple-touch-icon.png upon successful login and get a 404. Manually going to devilry.ifi.uio.no works as expected. The same happens even if I set chrome to "request desktop page".

This bug is not present in the AOSP browser.

title: Unsuccessful deliveries are counted in summary-grids for examiner and admins

labels.name: closed-not-relevant
labels.description: Clean up of old issues due to inactivity or irrelevance

body:
When a student starts making a delivery in Devilry (when the first file is uploaded), a delivery is created in the database, and this delivery is marked as unsuccessful. The API used by the examiner interface in version 1.1 counts any deliveries, not just successful. Fixing this is not a simple matter, so the issue will remain until we can replace that API.

The API has already been replaced for administrators in version 1.2 (not released at time of writing). The API was replaced for students in version 1.1.

See also: #336

title: Download files is displayed on NON-ELECTRONIC in the student UI

labels.name: closed-not-relevant
labels.description: Clean up of old issues due to inactivity or irrelevance

title: Approved from previous semester hangs when creating delivery
body:
The symptom is: I wanted to "accept" a student's oblig from an earlier semester. I found the stundent in the system, I found "opprove from earlier semester" in the menue "advanced". Then a "writing panel" shows where I can write a justification, also that seemed ok. But when I click the "green arrow" to continue (or finalize, don't know), the browser shows, as said:

```
"Creating a delivery on Group 0/1"
```

with this circling-kind-of symbols to indicate one should be patient, but even after 60 minutes it was still trying.

title: Tags is not shown in the examiner-interface
The feedback text is clipped in the student view for paper deliveries
IE 9 sideways scroll when multiple groups are selected

milestone.title: 1.2 - New subjectadmin UI
milestone.description: The 1.2 version of Devilry will include a brand new administrator user interface for administrators.

body: Seems to be an issue with the layout manager. May simply be that one of the layers have no layout manager specified.

title: Adding deliveries do not work in Opera - Filename must be unique
body: This is caused by the file field not resetting properly after file upload. A fix will be made shortly, however it does not have the highest priority since any platform with Opera also support other web browsers. We suggest you use Firefox or Chrome in the meantime, since they have the best test-coverage in Devilry.

title: Can not click on the "Add file" button with Firefox 14 on UiO linux machines
body: Everything seems to load fine, but the only the lower 3-4 pixels of the **Add new file** button is clickable.

title: Frontpage does not render in Firefox 3.6
body: The render event is never triggered, so the role-selector just keeps saying _Loading ..._.

title: Unsuccessful deliveries are available to admins (and examiners?)
body: When a student aborts a delivery, the `successful` flag is never set to `true`. These deliveries should never be shown in the UI, and they should be deleted automatically.

title: Links from feedback emails do not open the correct delivery
body:
Links open the correct group/student, but they do not open the delivery where the feedback was added.

The workaround for this is to manually select the deadline (normally the previous deadline) and then the feedback.

title: Can not sort by examiner in admin interface on an Assignment
Statistics advanced filter uses AND instead of OR
body: The advanced filter in the statistics app uses `AggregatedPeriodDataForStudentBase.passesAssignments`, which requires all assignments to be passed to return `true`. Should be easy to fix.

title: Statistics list of assignments renders wrong names
body:
`ListOfAssignments._getAssignmentRecordsFromIds` and `Filter._assignmentIdListToAssignmentRecords`  uses a fuzzy find that does not see the difference between `week1` and `week1_extra`. This needs to be changed to an exact find.

Note that this only affects rendering of the view, not the result of the filter.

title: Qualifes for exam - Manual - raises exception on save
Show "after deadline" warning
body: In list of deliveries

title: Students get question to create new deadline or close the group
body: Because of a missing check for role, students get the message intended for examiners when entering an assignment with no deliveries where the deadline has expired. This is purely a GUI bug. The student do not have permission to create new deadlines or to close the group.

title: Copy group name when copying groups
File download uses deliveryid instead of fileid
Creating groups and period-labels do not work
body: It seems there is a bug with AsyncActionPool (#229) that makes a huge percent of saves using it to fail.

title: Creating a deadline before the publishing time crashes without an error message
body: This is because it is checked by the underlying data abstraction layer, however the error is is not checked by the client-side javascript that is responsible for showing error messages to the user.

title: Jumbled links in student dashboard
body:
Noticed this issue myself and also got some questions from confused students.

On the student dashboard, sometimes links to deliveries in the recent deliveries/feedbacks tables get jumbled, ie. the destination you're linked to does not correspond to what you've click on.

I've seen this happen especially with different courses visible in the list and near the end.

**Repro example:**
Recent deliveries:
*INF2200
delivery a
*INF1060
delivery b
delivery c
*INF1300
delivery d

Click on "delivery d".

**Expecting:** to be taken to the delivery "d" from INF1300, which I clicked on.
**Actual:** taken to delivery "c" from INF1060.
Clicking on delivery "c" takes you to "d". 

I've seen this happen both in the deliveries and feedbacks list.
Unsure if it happens in the other dashes, I only examine in one course so it may be related to the fact that there are several courses in the list.

Browser: FF 3.6.22

title: Admins on assignments doesn't work
body:
Users registered as admins on assignments do not get admin privileges. They get a message saying "You are not registered as an admin...".

The only workaround is to register the users as admins on the period.

title: Uploading file implies delivery

labels.name: closed-not-relevant
labels.description: Clean up of old issues due to inactivity or irrelevance

body:
Again, sorry if this is some strange Ifi-site-specific issue.

Since the file delivery form does not allow you to remove a file that has been uploaded, and since upload begins automatically upon file pick, wrongfully picked files cannot be removed from a delivery.

Furthermore, once at least one file is uploaded, it appears the delivery is, implicitly, irrevocably made, even though the user has not confirmed it by pressing the "Deliver" button. Attempting to interrupt the delivery by browsing to another view, logging out or leaving the site by some other means does not abort or invalidate the delivery.

It is unintuitive and unclear that uploading is basically the same as delivering.
This is unfortunate since users may accidentally upload wrong files, perhaps even containing information they do not wish to share with the examiner/institution.

This could cause some other annoyances, too. At Ifi, for instance, delivery of mandatory assignments implies that the user accepts some guidelines regarding authorship of the assignments and so on, and with this behaviour it could be argued that a seemingly delivered files was not intended to be delivered and that these guidelines were not actually agreed to.

title: Download all deliveries - server error with non-english file names
Percentage signs in ReStructured Text
body:
There seems to be an issue with percentage signs used in RST.
If you add feedback which contains percentage signs, it seems to crash devilry-examiner.py upon sync.
I added feedback in the web interface, and it seemed to work fine, but syncing later resulted in this error:

  File "C:\Python26\lib\ConfigParser.py", line 669, in set
    "position %d" % (value, percent_index))
ValueError: invalid interpolation syntax in 'printf(%s XXXX %n");" at position XXX.

It seems python expects percentage signs to be doubled to escape them (%%), but the web interface doesn't interpret that as a single % in the preview.
Not sure exactly if the problem is with the web interface, or with the script that handles the downloaded text files.

title: The "Create a deadline"-alert does not go away
body: When you publish a new feedback without approving the assignment, you get a yellow box saying you should create a new deadline or close the group. But if you create a new deadline, you still get that box.

title: Unpublished results are visible
body: When a delivery is corrected and approved, but not yet published, the student can see the status as approved when viewing the delivery info page at  https://devilry.ifi.uio.no/django/main/student/delivery/[id]

title: Feedback last modified by always shows logged in user
body: In the feedback editor on the right side there is a Feedback box with the field feedback last modified by. This field shows the logged in user instead of the user who modified the feedback.

title: Download multiple groups as tar or zip failes on Apache webserver
body: At least we think it is a Apache issue, as this is not a issue on the development server even with the exact same version of devilry and a clone of the production database.

title: adding non-existing examiner to assignment
body: Adding an examiner which does not exist in the system gives the message: "Success Examiners successfully cleared." Maybe "Error: examiner not found. Contact xxxx for help" would be better?

title: filenames restrictions for assignments not working
body:
The GUI says: "If filenames are used, students will not be able to deliver files where the filename is not among the given filenames." I was able to hand in a file with a name not listed in the box. 

Suggestion: let it be possible to set the allowed number of files _and_ permissible filenames. E.g., _one_ file, but it can be either hello.rdf or hello.ttl.

title: Server error when saving a assignment with no parent node
body: This should of course show a error message.

title: Too much text in pop-ups
body: When for example distributing examiners randomly on a large number of exercises, the Growl-style pop-up contains way too much text. It both says "examiners successfully distributed" and gives a list of all students with their corresponding examiners, so the text continues down past the lower border of the pop up box.

title: Sorting deliveries by grade is incorrect
body: When viewing deliveries sorted by grade, the sorting is wrong. It is sorted lexically instead of numerically, which means that, for example 12/12 comes before 2/12 when sorting in ascending order.

title: Latest delivery time not showing until corrected
body: When administrating an assignment and looking at the assignment group table, the "Latest delivery" field is empty for all groups that have not been corrected yet, even though they have Deliveries. This should show by default.

title: Graceful exit upon ctrl-c while typing password.
body: At the moment the CLI falls into an exception if the user presses ctrl-c while typing the password while logging in. This should be made less noisy.
